872944223:
[

Principal ITS Domain Lead

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 727 Collins Street
  • Permanent Full Time


The work our ITS teams do today will change how we travel tomorrow by delivering safer, more sustainable travel. As the Principal ITS Domain Lead you will be responsible for supporting alignment of the business needs and strategies with the ITS solutions capability across a 1-10 year time horizon. Being inquisitive you will stay up to date with ITS innovations within the global industry and proactively work to future proof Transurban’s ITS domains (control systems, tolling solutions, surveillance, communications and safety systems) by aligning lifecycle refresh programs to market innovation and trends.

Our world-leading Intelligent Transport Systems teams support the creation of roads for the future. They make toll collections automated and easy. They deliver advanced control systems that monitor and manage traffic on the road – that can detect traffic incidents, and even predict when an accident is more likely to happen. They make roads ready for driverless cars, and co-ordinate smart traffic flow to get us where we’re going faster. A career here makes a difference.

The impact you’ll have
  • You'll research and present on what ITS will look like in the future
  • You’ll provide technical expertise in ITS Domain subject matter
  • You’ll manage engagement between ITS engineering and roads asset managers to deliver the best outcome
  • You’ll introduce new technology and cost improvements
  • You’ll demonstrate thought leadership and innovation through conceptual thinking and problem solving and work to formulate solutions within the ITS Domain
  • You’ll monitor and manage ITS Domain skills and capability planning and forecasts
  • You’ll work closely with ITS Engineering Managers and Architects to ensure smooth delivery of designs that are aligned to the ITS domain blueprint

The talents you’ll bring
  • A degree-qualified, professionally accredited engineer, you’ll have significant professional experience and a hands-on understanding of ITS engineering or a suitably transferable discipline gained within a complex, matrix organisation
  • You’ll have strong knowledge and be recognised as a thought leader across more than one ITS Domain
  • Ideally you’ll have consulting experience with proven ability to solve complex problems and link from operational matters to strategic impacts
  • You’ll be a sound communicator, including verbal communication skills, presentations, report writing and the preparation of concise management reports
  • You’ll come with proven experience working with senior business stakeholders to achieve successful business outcomes
  • You’ll be able to demonstrate strong customer focus and a team player willing to apply initiative in the work environment

The rewards you’ll earn
  • We’ll make sure you have the tools you need to work smart and live better – including remote & flexible working.
  • We’ll develop you the way you want, with study assistance, training and career planning.
  • We’ll offer flexible leave, public transport ticket purchasing programs, insurance and salary continuance.
  • We’ll help you be healthy with flu vaccinations, fitness classes, fresh fruit and mental health support.
  • We’ll invite you to plenty of social activities, including ones that give back to our communities.


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you. Click Apply now

Job description

Position Summary:

Reporting to the BA Team Leader, you will work to support the delivery of innovative technical solutions to the core software platforms and/or product enhancement projects. You will work closely within a Scrum Team in the execution of the projects.\xa0


  • Aviation Industry
  • Software Engineering and Pruducts
  • Australian SME-Exporting to Global Markets


About Us:

The Austrlian Family business that is continuing to grow our business into new territories and countries at a rapid rate. We have a fabulous location at the Paris end of Collins Street with excellent end of trip facilities and fabulous Ocean views. Come and be a part of something unique where you can make a difference.


About the Role:
  • Consult with stakeholders to produce the business requirements for product enhancements and participate in generating client solutions using Ocean products.
  • Analyse stakeholder requirements to identify implicit and detailed functional requirements, resolve conflicting requirements, clarify ambiguities and prepare Statement of Requirements
  • Design new quality system features and frameworks for products and/or projects on budget and within agreed timelines.
  • Maintain and upgrade existing system documentation as required.
  • Collaborate effectively with other Ocean employees including; Business Analysts, Project Leads, Developers, Testers and IT team to resolve issues and ensure solutions are viable and consistent.
  • Create system guidelines and manuals for the organisation.
  • Structure and prioritise business requirements and communicate plans to stakeholders for review and approval.
  • Research emerging technologies to determine if installing and using them will provide an increase in efficiency and effectiveness.
  • As required, conduct end to end testing to ensure that the system works as expected.

  • Exceptional communication abilities - liaising with both business and technical teams
  • Ability to work as a team and autonomously
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines


We require candidates to be Australian citizens (must be able to attain an Australian Defence security clearance)


Interstate candidates may apply if they are willing to relocate at their own expense

About the role

You’ll be responsible for managing environmental, heritage and planning matters across the operational areas of the business. \xa0 This will include the development and implementation of environmental controls and processes into current operational and maintenance activities and improvement projects.


Your focus will also be on implementing a range of industrial Waste Management Improvement measures across parts of the business.

With your hands-on experience in environmental management in a utilities or industrial setting, will use your strong communication skills ability to influence and engage others to achieve the desired outcomes for the organisation.

872453673:
[

Fullstack Developer \U0001f4bb | Work from home friendly \U0001f3e1 | Aussie founded Startup \U0001f4aa

Company Name affix Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 98 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We have partnered with a homegrown Aussie startup focusing on helping businesses consistently deliver great customer experiences every day. I’m pretty pumped about this one. So, without further ado, let me introduce you to RateIt.

The who

RateIt have created an easy and delightful way to gather in-person ratings and NPS to help retailers, healthcare providers and government groups improve their execution and find new growth opportunities. They do this in a way that's easy, delightful and makes a difference. How? I’m glad you asked.

They collect customer ratings via their beautiful tablet app, web app or physical tokens. On the back-end, their customers access insights through an online portal, giving them a clear view of their CX feedback at every interaction.

This is a team who really put their money where their mouth is: they run a super popular podcast (CX Leaders) and are serious about making a name for themselves as the authority in the customer feedback space, with big brand customers from all over the world already singing their praises.

Only having launched in 2016, they have already partnered with some pretty serious brands… Bose, Adidas, BMW, KFC, Fitness First, Harvey Norman, 7/11, just to name a few. And in these first two years, they’ve collected four million ratings and have grown to a team of 30 people! Pretty impressive yes?

The why
They have a proven product which both their public users and B2B customers love to use. Seriously, their engagement stats are kinda nuts. They are solving a real problem and have implemented a business model which is working – so they are well set up for some exciting long-term growth and are on track for a successful Series A.

This team is set up to function remote-first, with staff throughout Australia, a handful of people international and a hub now forming in Melbourne. This is where you come in.

The what
As a full-stack developer, you will join an engineering team of five (and growing) including two experienced full stack devs, one senior front end/UXer, one UI designer and one talented mobile dev. They’re supported by a product manager, a director of product and design and the CTO.

Working on all lines of product, you’ll be involved early in the process from technical, functional and UI/UX requirements through to delivery - building a delightful, high-performance web application. If you’re keen, there are opportunities to get involved in building the mobile apps, continuous integration and DevOps too.

Everyone in this team takes start-to-finish technical ownership of features and/or applications from inception to delivery. They work in a Scrum style, with sprints, retros, standups and an iterative, human-centred approach. Their product process is both data-driven and empathetic, with an emphasis on research and validation over feature factory shipping theatre.

Their tech stack today is a REST services architecture using ASP.NET with component-driven Angular 4 on the front-end. It’s hosted on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of Azure’s services.

The technical chops you will need… for all you bullet point lovers out there:

  • Proven significant experience working with multiple modern server-side languages including SQL and ASP.NET (or other similar MVC frameworks with enough seniority to transfer across)
  • Demonstrated experience coding in Javascript, particularly with SPA frameworks such as React or Angular
  • Proven understanding and experience in web application architecture, object-oriented software and advanced design patterns would be lovely to have
  • Experience working with a hosted cloud platform and ability to speak to the challenges and benefits, particularly Microsoft Azure
  • Startup experience is highly desirable - if you’re the magic mix of enterprise software and startup dreams, enquire within!


The how
They have a 'remote first' mentality. So, your role can be a mix of working from home, with the opportunity to hang out with the Melbourne crew from the coworking space/new WeWork office, or on the couch with your puppy on your lap. By “remote first” they mean remote team members are first class citizens, and the business is optimised for it: high collaboration, great tools and a strong team culture are guaranteed.

What’s in it for you?

The opportunity to have an impact and leave a legacy. You will have autonomy and you’ll be given a whole lot of growth opportunities. You’ll be working on an interesting product suite with a lot to do, whether it’s shaping process or creating real customer value.

I mentioned high transparency culture; this isn’t just another buzzword tagline. They live and breathe it. RateIt takes staff development seriously, and the autonomy and trust lead to high impact, satisfying work.

What do you want to learn? What are your goals? This might just be the place to be supported and follow those, finally!


Next steps:

Hi \U0001f44b I’m Breanna from affix. We help startups scale up through people. We are lucky enough to be partnering with RateIt to help them grow their brilliant team and business. I have SO MUCH more I can tell you about these peeps but this has gone on long enough already \U0001f606 So it's over to you now. Make sure you apply, but not just “I’ll flick my CV through kind-of-apply” I want to know your story that’s beyond just your CV. Tell me who you are and what you're most proud of that you have delivered and let's see if this is the right home for you.\xa0\U0001f3e1

Company Name AGL Energy Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 99 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The Data Platform team designs, builds and runs advanced solutions to deliver the information, analytics and platform capability required for AGL to continue being a leading customer focused, data driven organisation. We are building a diverse, collaborative and inclusive team, with a focus on putting the customer first, tackling big data challenges and having the right work/life balance. This includes assisting our team members with flexible working arrangements where needed.


We are seeking a Data Platform Architect who will leverage a best practice approach in use of the platform capabilities to integrate systems, master data sets, and work in partnership with the Analysis teams in provision of data and analysis output. You will primarily be responsible for data warehouse architecture and design of technical supporting components enabling high quality data solutions.


This is a 24 months fixed term contract position.


Your key responsibilities will be to:


To be successful, it is vital that the Data Platform Architect creates an engaging and innovative user experience for a range of AGL information consumers and communicates the art of the possible.


The role requires a strong work ethic and will be responsible for the following key responsibilities:

  • Accountable for delivery of solution architecture across the Enterprise data and analytics platforms, focusing on pattern-driven information architecture.
  • Provide specialist technical support to Data Scientists and the Data Analyst communities in the creation and use of data sets. Provide technical support in cataloguing of data sources.
  • Collaborate closely with application team architects and engineers to identify technologies and platforms suitable for their big data processing requirements, and then assist those teams with onboarding, development, deployment, and debugging on those platforms.
  • Investigate new big data tools and technologies for their potential application to common use cases; establishing best practices, developing design patterns, and writing documentation to disseminate new capabilities to a broad technical audience; working with platform engineers and product managers to specify and deliver new major technology features.
  • Provide technical assistance to a broad community of data infrastructure users, such as software application engineers and data scientists, through research, investigation, collaboration, and hands-on debugging, often driven by specific use case requirements.
  • Ensure that data solutions adhere to best practices and enterprise standards for scalability, availability, efficiency, data life-cycle management, information security, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery.
  • Provide trusted direction and guidance for the team with alignment to the overall CTO strategy and Enterprise Data architecture strategy.
  • Influence business & strategic partners to align with enterprise architecture strategy and deeper focus on data strategy.
  • Prioritize the delivery of the right data & analytics capabilities at the right time through innovation and proof of concepts.


To be successful, you'll have:


The ideal candidate will have success in leading a deep technical architecture and design discussions with senior executives, and able to be hands-on to show the depth of their experience and expertise.

  • Extensive experience working within an Information Management practice.
  • Solid experience with deep understanding in databases and analytics, including relational databases like SQL DB/DW and NoSQL platforms like HBase, MongoDB, Cassandra etc.
  • Strong work experience in the data architecture space.
  • Demonstrated data driven problem solving approaches.
  • Worked in an agile manner: hands on experience following agile and test-driven development.
  • Previous work designing/managing data structures within a data warehouse and understanding of data warehousing principals and practices (Schemas, Data Marts and Data repositories).
  • Experience working with SAP technologies (SAP Hana, SAP LT & Business objects).
  • Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects.
  • Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences.
  • Strong technical competency working with cloud platforms and technologies.
  • Result driven, able to set challenging goals, be assertive, be comfortable taking risks and learning from them, and a change agent who can influence, inspire and motivate others.


What's in it for you?


You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.


You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.


Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us


It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.


With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.


Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

Transaction Solutions Team Leader

Company Name ME Bank Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 88 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



About ME

 We're not like other banks.

ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future.

We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people. To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support, and environment to be heard.

ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.

We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.

About you

 First and foremost, you have strong banking operational experience and have worked in a high volume financial transaction environment previously. You're a smooth operator, always looking at things through a risk, controls and compliance lens.

Secondly, you're a customer-focused leader and when it comes to the crunch, you have no problems in making hard and fast decisions while keeping the customer in front of mind. People describe you as someone who inspires your team to be the best that they can be and you enjoy working collaboratively with those around you.

Lastly, you have an organic way of taking a problem and easily find a solution - while always producing high-quality work. You're really comfortable working in changing and ambiguous environments, always looking at smarter, and more efficient ways of doing business.

A bit about the role

 Due to an internal promotion, we are looking for someone to lead our Banking Operations (Transaction Solutions) Team.

Think of this team like the engine room of the bank, they keep the money moving, and you'll be taking ownership of risks and controls for all transactional processing while being responsible for banking hygiene within the team.

You'll be responsible for creating forecasts for Transaction Solutions processes while complying with all policies, processes, delegations and regulatory guidelines. You'll be able to showcase your strong leadership skills while adding value and demonstrating your ability to contribute to companywide reporting.

This role will continue to evolve and change over the coming months, as we look at streamlining some of the core processes that are currently active in this team, so if you're really the type of person who embraces change, then this could be the role for you.

About the Perks

 At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:


  • Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.
  • The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.
  • Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.
  • To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.
  • ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.
  • Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.


Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.

I was born to play this role
If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.

Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however, will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

HSSE Advisor, 14 Months, Castrol - Spotswood

Company Name BP Company Location Spotswood, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


As part of BP, Castrol is widely acknowledged as the world's leading specialist provider of Lubricant solutions. Although best known for our expertise in developing lubricants for cars and bikes, we also produce lubricants that directly affect our daily lives in other ways such as in gas and electricity production, transport industries, construction, earth moving vehicles and the marine and industrial sector in general.

We are now recruiting for an HSSE Advisor to join our VIC team for a fixed period of 14 months. Based in Spotswood and reporting to the National HSSE Manager, the role is primarily concerned with providing HSSE support, guidance and advice to the Plant Manager and management team. Additionally, the role assists in providing HSSE expertise in managing work place changes including engineering, construction practices and third party HSSE practices.

The role supports an on-site workforce of approximately 70 people.



Key Responsibilities:



* Provides assistance to the plant by supporting risk assessments, reviewing, providing input and assisting the team to implement and evaluate corrective actions to mitigate risks
* Ensure incident management, investigation and reporting is in place and managed effectively
* Implement Control of Work programs, C&CM program - including updating site emergency response plan
* Ensure Oil Spill response plan and Emergency Response plan is implemented and communicated through toolbox talks, team meetings and workshops
* Monitor and verify compliance with BP policies and regulatory legislation for all HSSE related matters at the plant
* Coach and support line management to fulfil their HSSE accountabilities
* Acting as a key member of the site HSSE Committee and driving key outputs and initiatives resulting from committee decisions


Essential Qualifications, Skills & Experience:


Applicants must hold formal safety qualifications in order to be considered for this vacancy. As a minimum a Certificate IV in Workplace Health & Safety is required. Applicants with a Bachelor's Degree in a safety discipline and those with post-graduate qualifications will be well regarded.


In addition applicants must also; have experience working in a manufacturing facility or a petrochemical/hydrocarbon production facility; have had experience working with all types of permits (e.g. Heights, CSE, Isolations, etc); have managed on-site incident investigations; have a working knowledge of ISO14001 through either implementing it on site or managing its requirements at a production facility.


This is not a senior opportunity and, as such, is best suited to an HSSE professional in their early to mid-career.


At all times your priority will be to ensure that all tasks undertaken by you and our third party contractors are executed in line with BP and regulatory policies and standards.

873957435:
[

Company Manager - Come From Away

Company Name Newtheatricals Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Producers are seeking an experienced Company Manager to take responsibility of the daily operational and company management of the Australian production of Come From Away, commencing in Melbourne in 2019.

\xa0

This position is responsible for the logistics for and daily management of a touring company of 39 artists, production staff and musicians, as well as specialist staff and contractors. \xa0The Company Manager will be responsible for financial management of all daily operations and the management of financial expenditure and income, including input on ticketing inventory and yield management.

\xa0

The ideal candidate should have a minimum of four years proven experience in the commercial theatre or within the live entertainment industry in a senior management position. Experience in venue or company management or administration role would be an advantage.

\xa0

This is a full-time touring position supported by a deputy, and reports to the Executive Producer.

\xa0

The scope of this position includes:

\xa0

  • Acting as representation of the Producers to all parties involved with the production.
  • Supervising and executing the general and company management of the production including the supervision of all artists, musicians, production heads of department, stage management and all specialist production staff.
  • Liaising with all creative staff of the production in respect of the general management of the rehearsals, production and operation of the production.
  • Liaising with the production’s publicist, marketing staff and ticketing organisations.
  • Liaising with venue management, venue staff, front of house, merchandise and box office staff in the general operation of the production.
  • In respect of ticketing, this includes daily communication with box office staff in coordination with the Producers to ensure maximum inventory yield, accurate reporting, and management of house seats.
  • Negotiating and drafting production contracts in accordance with the budget allocation and guidelines of the Producers.
  • Processing payroll for the production’s employees.
  • Providing analysis and subsequent budget information to the Producers to enable decision-making process.
  • Industrial Relations.
  • Coordinating all travel, accommodation and per diem requirements of the production.
  • Coordinating publicity requirements including the arrangement of public appearances for promotional reasons, working closely with the publicity and marketing teams.
  • Consulting with the Producers, technical direction and heads of department to ensure the production’s operations are fully executed in an efficient manner, and that they are correctly documented for future reference.
  • Ensuring all health and safety requirements of the venue and production are executed and correctly documented.

\xa0

Key selection criteria include:

\xa0

  • A proven understanding of theatre and the performing arts industry as a “business”
  • Experience in the Theatre or Live Entertainment industry
  • Proven business experience
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to influence
  • Ability to manage competing demands, set priorities and work to tight deadlines
  • Attention to detail
  • Proven budgeting/costing and problem-solving experience
  • Proven knowledge of the relevant industrial awards is ideal
  • A team player within a small group, but also able to work autonomously
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel and excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must.

\xa0

Salary:base annual salary $98,800 + superannuation

\xa0

Commencement: Position will commence on or around 6thMay 2019 \xa0

\xa0

Applications:

\xa0

  • Written applications should be addressed to Kiaya Hacene, Executive Producer via careers@newtheatricals.com (or on linked in)
  • Applications must include acovering letter detailing professional experience and a current CV with contacts for two referees.
  • Applications close Friday 12th October 2018
  • Applicants must have the legal right to work in Australia.
  • Strictly no recruitment agencies.
  • Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

[

Receptionist/Administrative Assistant

Company Name Accuteque Company Location Level 12, 45 William Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Come join our small, but close-knit team at Accuteque’s head office in the heart of Melbourne! Whilst we’re a hardworking group, we also know how to celebrate the wins. We’re looking for a part-time receptionist/administrative assistant to hit the ground running, someone who is a self-sufficient, quick learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You’ll be the first face people see as they enter the office, so a friendly nature is key. If this sounds like you, send your resume through! We can’t wait to meet you.


This will be a part time 'job share' role, with the successful candidate working 20 hours per week.



General Administration

  • Greet all visitors to Accuteque in a professional and polite manner when unattended by the office administrator
  • Corporate hosting
  • Maintain reception and meeting rooms (keep tidy and ready to use)
  • Provide refreshments, catering and any other resources (i.e. technology or stationery) for meetings as requested
  • Maintain office birthday calendar and deliver cupcake on employee birthdays
  • Screening of calls and respond to queries
  • Schedule meeting rooms, teleconferences and other resources for Accuteque employees and clients as necessary
  • Training and event booking support when requested
  • Manage requests that come into the office email account and direct to appropriate recipient
  • Conduct site visits where appropriate for collections and distribution of documents
  • Maintain office filing (including confidential HR filing, finance filing and client filing)
  • Schedule and respond to office alerts calendar
  • Maintain asset register and BSU security register
  • Work together with the BSU to provide support for internal Accuteque events
  • Prepare and review company documentation as per style guide when requested (i.e. portfolio documentation, office guides etc.)
  • Manage stationery and amenities supply, storage, requests and orders
  • Liaise with technology provider and building manager to resolve minor office issues
  • Provide administrative support to team as needed (i.e. document preparation, corporate hosting)
  • Assistance with travel requests when needed
  • Other duties as requested


Finance Assistance

  • As required process AP to SMASH
  • As required consolidate Petty Cash expenditure
  • Assist with Workflow Max and Xero Administration where required

Recruitment and HR Assistance

  • Monitor website/office email for CVs
  • Prepare interview documentation for potential Accuteque Candidates
  • Schedule Candidate interviews and introductions
  • Complete and update Accuteque Candidate Profiles as requested
  • Complete onboarding tasks such as email, Xero and Workflow Max account setups, contract drafting, and additional tasks as required
  • Conduct inductions for new employees as required

Qualifications, Experience and Behavioural Qualities

  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent relationship management skills
  • Strong customer service ethic
  • Able to work effectively in teams with all levels of Management
  • Enthusiastic to learn new skills and ‘hit the ground running’ with tasks
  • Ability to clearly communicate potential road blocks or issues when faced with difficult or unfamiliar tasks or excessive workload
  • Organised and methodical
  • Articulate and confident telephone manner
  • Trustworthy and reliable, able to maintain confidences
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience in preparation of documents such as proposals, contracts, reports and communications
  • Intermediate MS Office skills (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
  • Familiar with programs such as Survey Monkey, Hootsuite and Adobe Acrobat, social media platforms, trello advantageous
  • Experience with basic accounting processes and programs such as Xero or similar advantageous
  • Ability to work independently and manage conflicting work priorities
  • Able to organise and deliver work according to agreed priorities and timeframes
  • Experience in a similar role advantageous
  • Agile and doesn’t mind rolling their sleeves up when needed

873902951:
[

Mobile UI/UX Designer

Company Name Domestic Cat Software Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Domestic Cat


Domestic Cat is an established digital agency who specialise in building only the highest quality native mobile apps.

Our team is based entirely onshore, in Abbotsford, Victoria and we comprise end-to-end product delivery disciplines including:

  • Consultancy

  • UI/UX research and design

  • iOS and Android native application development

  • Web application development

  • Quality assurance

We have a varied client base, including government, enterprise and US-based startups, meaning our team get to work on a variety of projects using cutting edge technology.

We love new technology and innovation and are always looking for new things to build and new ways of doing things. \xa0We are looking for high performing team players to join us to work onupcoming cutting edge mobile projects.


Why work at Domestic Cat

We have a diverse and inclusive \xa0work environment, situated in a new and comfortable office overlooking the river in Abbotsford.

We also support flexible working arrangements.

As a team we get excited about learning new things be it new technology or new ways of doing things and organise in house professional development afternoons. We like to celebrate our wins and have fun while building exceptional products for our clients who we love.


About the role


We are looking for talented UX designer with native mobile experience and working in an Agile environment. Experience in product design, user research and user testing would be advantageous.

The role includes the following responsibilities:

  • Write user stories and acceptance criteria as required

  • Liaise with developers and quality assurance and project stakeholders to ensure designs meet requirements and are implemented as per design.

  • Complete UX and visual design for mobile apps including, flow diagrams, wireframes, design systems and visual design

  • Be responsible for UX research and user testing activities including designing research studies and reporting results

  • Complete Project Management tasks as required

  • Maintain and share knowledge of best practices in UX design



About you


You will be a team player who enjoys collaborating with our highly skilled team and our clients.

You will strive to make our products of the highest quality and enjoy sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team. We are looking for a self-starter who is able to set their own direction but also can collaborate with the team.

Specifically, you will have:


  • At least 2 years of digital UX design experience

  • Experience in native mobile apps

  • Experience conducting product design workshops

  • Experience in designing and executing UX research studies

  • Experience in conducting user testing

  • Ability to understand analytics and survey results

  • Solid understanding of Agile project processes

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to use Sketch, Zeplin and Adobe Creative Cloud

  • Experience using Jira and other project management tools

  • Tertiary education in Design or equivalent would be highly desirable



Apply today by clicking the apply button.
